summary.text:
The event system allows you to emit events to the backend and listen to events from it.

This package is also accessible with
The label of the window that emitted this event.
Emits an event to the backend.
Event name. Must include only alphanumeric characters,
Listen to an event from the backend.

content.text:
A promise resolving to a function to unlisten to the event.
Note that removing the listener is required if your listener goes out of scope e.g. the component is unmounted.

summary.text: Event name. Must include only alphanumeric characters,
Listen to an one-off event from the backend.

content.text:
A promise resolving to a function to unlisten to the event.
Note that removing the listener is required if your listener goes out of scope e.g. the component is unmounted.

summary.text: Event name. Must include only alphanumeric characters,

Clears mocked functions/data injected by the other functions in this module.
When using a test runner that doesn't provide a fresh window object for each test, calling this function will reset tauri specific properties.

# Example

Intercepts all IPC requests with the given mock handler.

This function can be used when testing tauri frontend applications or when running the frontend in a Node.js context during static site generation.

# Examples

Mocks one or many window labels.
In non-tauri context it is required to call this function *before* using the

module.

This function only mocks the *presence* of windows,
window properties (e.g. width and height) can be mocked like regular IPC calls using the
Label of window this JavaScript context is running in.
Label of additional windows the app has.
